query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
1 Di nova pena mi conven far versi 2 e dar matera al ventesimo canto 3 de la prima canzon, ch’è d’i sommersi.
query.result: 1 Of new pain I must make verses 2 and give material to the twentieth song 3 of the first song, which is of those submerged.

4 I was already prepared all 5 to look into the revealed bottom, 6 that was wetting with anguished weeping;
7 and I saw people through the round valley 8 coming, silently and weeping, at the pace 9 that litanies make in this world.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
10 Come ’l viso mi scese in lor più basso, 11 mirabilmente apparve esser travolto 12 ciascun tra ’l mento e ’l principio del casso,
13 ché da le reni era tornato ’l volto, 14 e in dietro venir li convenia, 15 perché ’l veder dinanzi era lor tolto.
query.result:
10 As my gaze descended among them lower, 11 wonderfully it appeared to be overturned 12 each one between the chin and the beginning of the hair,
13 because from the kidneys the face had returned, 14 and backwards it was necessary for them to come, 15 because the seeing in front was taken from them.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
16 Forse per forza già di parlasia 17 si travolse così alcun del tutto; 18 ma io nol vidi, né credo che sia.

Please translate each line literally into English.
19 Se Dio ti lasci, lettor, prender frutto 20 di tua lezione, or pensa per te stesso 21 com’ io potea tener lo viso asciutto,
22 quando la nostra imagine di presso 23 vidi sì torta, che ’l pianto de li occhi 24 le natiche bagnava per lo fesso.
query.result:
19 If God leaves you, reader, to take fruit 20 of your lesson, now think for yourself 21 how I could keep my face dry,
22 when our image nearby 23 I saw so twisted, that the weeping of the eyes 24 moistened the buttocks through the cleft.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
25 Certo io piangea, poggiato a un de’ rocchi 26 del duro scoglio, sì che la mia scorta 27 mi disse: «Ancor se’ tu de li altri sciocchi?
28 Qui vive la pietà quand’ è ben morta; 29 chi è più scellerato che colui 30 che al giudicio divin passion comporta?
31 Drizza la testa, drizza, e vedi a cui 32 s’aperse a li occhi d’i Teban la terra; 33 per ch’ei gridavan tutti: “Dove rui,
34 Anfïarao? perché lasci la guerra?”.
query.result:
25 Certainly I was weeping, leaning on one of the rocks 26 of the hard cliff, so that my companion 27 said to me: “Are you still of the other foolish ones?
28 Here lives pity when it is truly dead; 29 who is more wicked than he who 30 brings passion to the divine judgment?
31 Straighten your head, straighten, and see to whom 32 the earth opened before the eyes of the Thebans; 33 for they all cried out: “Where are you falling,
34 Amphion? why do you abandon the war?”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
35 E non restò di ruinare a valle 36 fino a Minòs che ciascheduno afferra.
37 Mira c’ha fatto petto de le spalle; 38 perché volle veder troppo davante, 39 di retro guarda e fa retroso calle.
query.result:
35 And there remained to fall down the valley 36 until Minos who grasps everyone.
37 Look how he made a breast of his shoulders; 38 because he wanted to see too far ahead, 39 looks behind and makes a backward street.

40 See Tiresias, who changed appearance 41 when from male he became female, 42 changing all his limbs;
43 and before, then, he had to strike them 44 the two serpents coiled, with the rod, 45 that he might restore the masculine feathers.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
46 Aronta è quel ch’al ventre li s’atterga, 47 che ne’ monti di Luni, dove ronca 48 lo Carrarese che di sotto alberga,
49 ebbe tra ’ bianchi marmi la spelonca 50 per sua dimora; onde a guardar le stelle 51 e ’l mar non li era la veduta tronca.
query.result:
46 Arunta is he who clings to their bellies, 47 who in the mountains of Luni, where roars 48 the Carrarese who dwells below,
49 had among the white marbles the cave 50 for his dwelling; whence to look at the stars 51 and the sea, their sight was not truncated.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
52 E quella che ricuopre le mammelle, 53 che tu non vedi, con le trecce sciolte, 54 e ha di là ogne pilosa pelle,
55 Manto fu, che cercò per terre molte; 56 poscia si puose là dove nacqu’ io; 57 onde un poco mi piace che m’ascolte.

Please translate each line literally into English.
58 Poscia che ’l padre suo di vita uscìo 59 e venne serva la città di Baco, 60 questa gran tempo per lo mondo gio.
query.result: 58 Afterwards that her father exited life 59 and came servant the city of Bacchus, 60 this great time she went through the world.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
61 Suso in Italia bella giace un laco, 62 a piè de l’Alpe che serra Lamagna 63 sovra Tiralli, c’ha nome Benaco.
query.result: 61 Above in beautiful Italy lies a lake, 62 at the foot of the Alps that encloses Lamagna 63 above Tiralli, which has the name Benaco.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
64 Per mille fonti, credo, e più si bagna 65 tra Garda e Val Camonica e Pennino 66 de l’acqua che nel detto laco stagna.
query.result: 64 Through a thousand springs, I believe, and more it wets 65 between Garda and Val Camonica and Pennino 66 of the water that in the said lake stagnates.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
67 Loco è nel mezzo là dove ’l trentino 68 pastore e quel di Brescia e ’l veronese 69 segnar poria, s’e’ fesse quel cammino.
query.result: 67 A place is in the middle there where the Trentino 68 shepherd and that of Brescia and the Veronese 69 could mark, if that path were made.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
70 Siede Peschiera, bello e forte arnese 71 da fronteggiar Bresciani e Bergamaschi, 72 ove la riva ’ntorno più discese.
query.result: 70 Sits Peschiera, beautiful and strong equipment 71 to face the Brescians and Bergamasks, 72 where the shore around descends more.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
73 Ivi convien che tutto quanto caschi 74 ciò che ’n grembo a Benaco star non può, 75 e fassi fiume giù per verdi paschi.
query.result: 73 There it happens that everything falls 74 that in the bosom of Benaco cannot stay, 75 and makes a river down through green meadows.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
76 Tosto che l’acqua a correr mette co, 77 non più Benaco, ma Mencio si chiama 78 fino a Governol, dove cade in Po.
query.result: 76 As soon as the water begins to run with it, 77 no longer Benaco, but Mincio it is called 78 until Governolo, where it falls into Po.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
79 Non molto ha corso, ch’el trova una lama, 80 ne la qual si distende e la ’mpaluda; 81 e suol di state talor essere grama.

Please translate each line literally into English.
82 Quindi passando la vergine cruda 83 vide terra, nel mezzo del pantano, 84 sanza coltura e d’abitanti nuda.
query.result: 82 Then passing, the crude virgin 83 saw land, in the middle of the swamp, 84 without cultivation and naked of inhabitants.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
85 Lì, per fuggire ogne consorzio umano, 86 ristette con suoi servi a far sue arti, 87 e visse, e vi lasciò suo corpo vano.
query.result: 85 There, to flee every human company, 86 she stayed with her servants to practice her arts, 87 and lived, and there left her empty body.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
88 Li uomini poi che ’ntorno erano sparti 89 s’accolsero a quel loco, ch’era forte 90 per lo pantan ch’avea da tutte parti.
query.result: 88 The men then who were scattered around 89 gathered to that place, which was strong 90 because of the swamp that had on all sides.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
91 Fer la città sovra quell’ ossa morte; 92 e per colei che ’l loco prima elesse, 93 Mantüa l’appellar sanz’ altra sorte.

Please translate each line literally into English.
94 Già fuor le genti sue dentro più spesse, 95 prima che la mattia da Casalodi 96 da Pinamonte inganno ricevesse.
query.result: 94 Already the people of it were denser within, 95 before the mud from Casalodi 96 received deceit from Pinamonte.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
97 Però t’assenno che, se tu mai odi 98 originar la mia terra altrimenti, 99 la verità nulla menzogna frodi».
query.result: 97 Therefore I assure you that, if you ever hear 98 originate my land differently, 99 the truth has no fraud or lies.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
100 E io: «Maestro, i tuoi ragionamenti 101 mi son sì certi e prendon sì mia fede, 102 che li altri mi sarien carboni spenti.
query.result: 100 And I: “Master, your reasonings 101 are so certain and take so much my faith, 102 that the others would be to me extinguished coals.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
103 Ma dimmi, de la gente che procede, 104 se tu ne vedi alcun degno di nota; 105 ché solo a ciò la mia mente rifiede».

Please translate each line literally into English.
106 Allor mi disse: «Quel che da la gota 107 porge la barba in su le spalle brune, 108 fu—quando Grecia fu di maschi vòta,
109 sì ch’a pena rimaser per le cune— 110 augure, e diede ’l punto con Calcanta 111 in Aulide a tagliar la prima fune.
query.result:
106 Then he said to me: “He who from the throat 107 extends the beard upon the dark shoulders, 108 was—when Greece was emptied of men,
109 so that scarcely remained for the wedges— 110 an augur, and gave the signal with Calchas 111 in Aulis to cut the first rope.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
112 Euripilo ebbe nome, e così ’l canta 113 l’alta mia tragedìa in alcun loco: 114 ben lo sai tu che la sai tutta quanta.
query.result: 112 Eurypylus had the name, and thus it sings 113 my high tragedy in some place: 114 well do you know it, who know it all.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
115 Quell’ altro che ne’ fianchi è così poco, 116 Michele Scotto fu, che veramente 117 de le magiche frode seppe ’l gioco.
query.result: 115 That other who is so little in the flanks, 116 was Michael Scot, who truly 117 of the magical frauds knew the game.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
118 Vedi Guido Bonatti; vedi Asdente, 119 ch’avere inteso al cuoio e a lo spago 120 ora vorrebbe, ma tardi si pente.
query.result: 118 See Guido Bonatti; see Asdente, 119 who would have understood the leather and the twine 120 now, but repents too late.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
121 Vedi le triste che lasciaron l’ago, 122 la spuola e ’l fuso, e fecersi ’ndivine; 123 fecer malie con erbe e con imago.

query.result:
124 But come now, because already it holds the boundary 125 of both hemispheres and touches the wave 126 under Subilia, Cain, and the thorns;
127 and already the moon was full last night: 128 be mindful to remember, because it harmed you not 129 at any time through the deep forest.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
130 Sì mi parlava, e andavamo introcque.
query.result: 130 Thus spoke to me, and we went onward.
